transcript.text: Welcome everyone to today's training session on our new product features. We have some exciting updates to share with you.
First, let's talk about the new dashboard analytics feature. This gives our customers real-time insights into their usage patterns.
That sounds great Jennifer. How will this help us during sales conversations with prospects?
Excellent question David. The analytics can show immediate value to prospects by demonstrating how they can optimize their workflows and reduce costs.
From a customer success perspective, this will be incredibly helpful for our quarterly business reviews. We can show concrete ROI data.
Exactly Lisa. Now, the second feature is our new integration marketplace. Customers can now connect with over fifty third-party applications.
This is perfect timing. We've been getting lots of requests for Salesforce and HubSpot integrations in our marketing campaigns.
Both of those are available Robert. The integrations are designed to be one-click setup with automatic data synchronization.
What about the pricing for these integrations? Is it included in the base plan or are there additional costs?
The first five integrations are included in all plans. Additional integrations are available at ten dollars per month each.
That's very competitive pricing. I think our customers will appreciate the flexibility to choose only the integrations they need.
The third major feature is enhanced mobile support. We've completely redesigned the mobile app with offline functionality.
This addresses one of our biggest customer pain points. Mobile usage has been growing significantly in our user base.
The offline functionality will be a huge selling point for our enterprise customers who travel frequently.
Absolutely. Users can now access and edit their data even without internet connection, and everything syncs automatically when they're back online.
When will these features be rolled out to existing customers? Should we start preparing our communication strategy?
The rollout begins next week for our enterprise customers, followed by professional plans the week after, and basic plans by month end.
I'll coordinate with the marketing team to prepare announcement materials and update our website content accordingly.
I'd like to schedule some demo sessions with my key prospects who have been waiting for these features.
That's a great idea David. I'll send everyone demo scripts and talking points after this session.
Should we also prepare some case studies showing the benefits? I have a few customers who would be perfect examples.
Definitely Lisa. Let's connect after this meeting to identify the best customer stories and start developing those case studies.
Before we wrap up, are there any other questions about these new features or how they impact your respective roles?
This has been very helpful. I'm excited to start incorporating these updates into our messaging.
Perfect. Thank you all for your time and great questions.
